title: The Trend
text: The Trend was a <a href="Marxist-Leninist">Marxist-Leninist</a> political movement of the mid-1970s through the mid-1990s in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It consisted of a loose collection of small <a href="communist">communist</a> organizations, newspapers, and theoretical groups that staked out a line that was intermediate between the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a>-aligned <a href="Communist%20Party%2C%20USA">Communist Party, USA</a> and the <a href="Third-worldist">Third-worldist</a>-oriented, <a href="Maoist">Maoist</a> <a href="New%20Communist%20Movement">New Communist Movement</a>. Groups that were part of The Trend include "<a href="National%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>" newspaper (now defunct, not to be confused with "<a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian (UK)</a>") and the associated Guardian Clubs, Line of March (later Frontline Political Organization), "Crossroads", Organizing Committee for an Ideological Center, <a href="El%20Comite-MINP">El Comite-MINP</a>, and other groups.
